channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Intl Homepage - News
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Intl Homepage - News

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2016 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Cops hunt Tunisian suspect after finding ID papers in truck
item.description: A manhunt is underway for whoever was behind the truck attack on a Berlin Christmas market that left 12 people dead and 48 injured.

item.title: Berlin mourns: 'The people who do this are animals'
item.description: Streets that would normally be bustling with shoppers and friends meeting over steaming mugs of mulled wine five days before Christmas are eerily quiet.

item.title: Slain driver was not at wheel
item.description: The slain driver of a truck that was used to kill 12 people at the Berlin market had asked to finish his duties early so he could buy a Christmas gift for his wife, according to the owner of the trucking company.

item.title: Fireworks market explodes: 31 dead, dozens injured
item.description: The explosion took place in Tultepec -- about 40 kilometers (about 25 miles) north of Mexico City -- where pyrotechnics are a major industry.

item.title: Syrian girl, 7, meets Turkey's President
item.description: Bana Alabed, the seven-year-old Syrian girl who brought the plight of Aleppo's victims to the world, wrote the latest chapter in her extraordinary story by meeting Turkish president Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Ankara.

item.title: US returns land its controlled since WWII
item.description: The US military will hand over a 9,909 acres (4,000 hectares) of Okinawan land to Japan Thursday, in what's lauded as the largest return of US-occupied land since 1972.

item.title: Tennis star's 5 digits slashed in attack
item.description: Two-time Wimbledon tennis champion Petra Kvitova has undergone a near four-hour operation on "severe" hand injuries sustained after she was attacked by a knife-wielding robber in her apartment near the Czech capital of Prague Tuesday.

item.title: Russia: No concessions to 'terrorists'
item.description: Russia warned it will not make "concessions to terrorists" a day after its ambassador was gunned down in the Turkish capital, Ankara.

item.title: Obama has 1 month to lock in legacy
item.description: President Barack Obama, as his tenure draws to a close, is deploying his legal authority in a last-minute bid to cement the areas of his legacy threatened by Donald Trump's incoming administration.

item.title: Obama bans drilling to hamper Trump
item.description: Looking to cement his environmental record, President Barack Obama took new action Tuesday barring offshore drilling in areas of the Arctic and Atlantic oceans indefinitely.

item.title: Trump strikes back at Bill Clinton
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump mocked Bill Clinton on Tuesday after the former president said Trump "doesn't know much" in an interview with a local paper.

item.title: Assassination photographer's chilling find
item.description: The Associated Press photographer who captured viral images of Russian ambassador Andrey Karlov's assassination at an art exhibition in Ankara has recalled the terrifying moment the gunman opened fire.

item.title: '80s heartthrob subdues airline passenger
item.description: An unruly passenger on an Korean Air flight Tuesday should've known better than to attack the crew with Richard Marx on board. The '80s singer was right there waiting for him -- with rope.

item.title: 'Suicide Squad' star's relationship status
item.description: Margot Robbie offered a saucy response to speculation that she's gotten married.

item.title: Australian Open prize a record $36 million
item.description: After being rocked by allegations of match-fixing earlier this year, the Australian Open will have a record $36 million prize pot as it tries to combat corruption at the lower rungs of the sport.

item.title: Should you wear a pollution mask?
item.description: Alexander HjertstrÃ¶m thought his breathing problems were behind him. But when he embarked upon a study trip to India, an old foe came spluttering back to life.

item.title: Trump's still going wrong on Twitter
item.description: When the President-elect speaks, people listen -- and governments, businesses and ordinary citizens scramble to parse, interpret and, given his power, make snap decisions about how to act and respond.

item.title: Michelle Obama: I'm helping Trump
item.description: While Michelle Obama was a harsh critic of Donald Trump on the campaign trail, the first lady says in an interview that she is supportive of the country's incoming new leader.

item.title: 15 of the best places to spend Christmas
item.description: Any old city can string up a few lights downtown and call it a holiday celebration.

item.title: Facebook's 'Voice of God'
How to make the most of midlife
item.description: I had always planned on having a dance party for my 50th birthday this year. Think how fun it would be: hire a DJ, invite friends and family and dance the night away like I did in college.

item.title: Why this man injects himself with snake venom
item.description: As he approached his 50th birthday, Steve Ludwin felt like he might finally be growing out of his long-term habit.

item.title: Rugby player's incredible trick goes viral
item.description: It's the sort of trick that could make you a hero -- or leave you looking like a bit of a chump.

item.title: Where are these legends now?
item.description: From Bjorn Borg to Steffi Graf, CNN has spoken to plenty of tennis legends in 2016. Find out they have been up to since hanging up their rackets.

item.title: Summer and winter Olympian: 'I am a tough chick'
item.description: US Winter and Summer Olympian, Lolo Jones, tells Don Riddell there should be no doubt she is one "tough chick."

item.title: Crash that killed soccer team pilot error
item.description: Human error caused a November 28 plane crash that killed 71 people, including members of the Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense, the Bolivian government said Tuesday.

item.title: Steamy portraits of Londoners at night
item.description: The pictures in this book were made over three winters between 5.30pm and 7.30pm as commuters traveled home by bus from their jobs in The City of London to the suburbs.

item.title: Skiing in the 'home of Santa Claus'
item.description: Skiing in Santa Claus' back yard sounds like every child's dream.

item.title: On patrol with the Reindeer Police
item.description: Photographer Gianmarco Maraviglia describes Norway's northernmost counties of Finnmark and Troms as a white expanse in every direction -- vast and open like the Sahara, but covered in snow.

item.title: 'Star Wars' spots that really exist
item.description: Plenty of people dream of traveling to other planets.

item.title: Snow falls in Sahara for first time in 37 years
item.description: Bob Geldof and Midge Ure are better musicians than they are meteorologists.

item.title: Behind the magical scenes of the 'Nutcracker'
item.description: Perhaps it's Tchaikovsky's instantly recognizable score, the festive set design, fairytale costumes, or the familiarity of the plot -- whatever the reason "The Nutcracker" has become a staple of the Christmas season.

item.title: South Africa's whites-only town
item.description: Orania is not prime real estate by any stretch of the imagination.

item.title: Killer trucks: A frightening form of low-tech terror
item.description: Terrorists have turned to a frightening weapon that often is within easy reach and is particularly hard to guard against: using cars and trucks as killing machines.

item.title: Russia's long battle with Islamic radicals
item.description: Militants that routinely attack Russian government facilities may have pledged allegiance to ISIS. Nick Paton Walsh examines the implications for the Middle East conflict.

item.title: How Trump can respond to US hostage appeal
item.description: In an unprecedented public appeal to an incoming president, kidnapped American citizen Caitlin Coleman addressed President-elect Donald Trump directly in a video, urging him to secure the release of her and her family.

item.title: New white, same old story
item.description: Donald Trump's election ushered in the rise of the "new white," a rising movement poised to recalibrate America's racial balance of power. The movement's narrative is simple: Whether Trump's election signals triumph or doom, America's most important next step is to reach out, embrace, and better understand the ignored, maligned and threatened white working class. Heralded by voices on both the left and right, the narrative explains Trump's victory, diagnoses Hillary Clinton's Electoral College loss, and prescribes how the nation should move forward.

item.title: Assassination in Turkey recalls build-up to WWI
item.description: On June 28, 1914, a 19-year-old Serbian nationalist named Gavrilo Princip fired into an open-top car traveling through the streets of Sarajevo, carrying Archduke Franz Ferdinand, heir to the throne of the Austria-Hungarian Empire.

item.title: No fees on International Payments
Fix your Exchange Rates today with
Buy and Sell in 33 currencies with
Raped 43,000 times, but fighting back
Saving children from life on the streets
item.description: Andy Stein shifts on the balls of his feet, leans against a wooden railing, and fidgets.

item.title: Canadian teenagers sold for sex
item.description: As Lauren Chopek painfully details her story, she does so with the reticence of a survivor, as if somehow remaining silent would have been better.

item.title: Child predator caught by tiny clue in photo
Girls drugged and sold as child brides
item.description: "When I woke up I didn't know that I was in China."

item.title: The '5 disguises' used by human traffickers
item.description: Across the U.S., there is a movement to prioritize human trafficking prevention in our nation's communities. Schools, youth service programs, juvenile corrections services, group homes, and other youth-oriented spaces have begun to recognize their great potential to empower youth to stay safe from exploitation.

item.title: Video captures Mexico's fireworks explosion
item.description: Explosions ripped through a fireworks market north of Mexico City on Tuesday, killing at least 29 people.

item.title: Photographer captures assassination
item.description: An AP photographer who captured images of Russian ambassador Andrey Karlov's assassination at an art exhibition in Ankara recalls the terrifying moment the gunman opened fire.
